# MTLDeviceLocation

**Enumeration**

Indicates the location of the GPU relative to the system it’s connect to.

## Declaration

```swift
enum MTLDeviceLocation
```

## Overview

Check the location of a GPU by checking the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice/location] property of its [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDevice] instance.

## Determining the GPU’s location

- **MTLDeviceLocation.builtIn**: A location that indicates the GPU is permanently connected to the system internally.
- **MTLDeviceLocation.slot**: A GPU location that indicates a person connected the GPU to a system’s internal slot.
- **MTLDeviceLocation.external**: A GPU location that indicates a person connected the GPU to the system with an external interface, such as Thunderbolt.
- **MTLDeviceLocation.unspecified**: A value that indicates the system can’t determine how the GPU connects to it.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Identifying a GPU device

- **name**: The full name of the GPU device.
- **architecture**: The architectural details of the GPU device.
- **MTLArchitecture**: A class that contains the architectural details of a GPU device.
- **registryID**: The GPU device’s registry identifier.
- **location**: The physical location of the GPU relative to the system.
- **locationNumber**: A specific GPU position based on its general location.
- **isLowPower**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the GPU lowers its performance to conserve energy.
- **isRemovable**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the GPU is removable.
- **isHeadless**: A Boolean value that indicates whether a GPU device doesn’t have a connection to a display.
- **peerGroupID**: The peer group ID the GPU belongs to, if applicable.
- **peerCount**: The total number of GPUs in the peer group, if applicable.
- **peerIndex**: The unique identifier for a GPU in a peer group.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
